errors.message: The {0} element cannot be the child of the {1} element.
errors.description: An element was placed inside an invalid parent element.
errors.resolution: Check the allowed parent elements in the schema documentation.

errors.message: The {0} attribute is required on the {1} element.
errors.description: A required attribute is missing from an element.
errors.resolution: Add the missing required attribute to the element.

errors.description: Two elements have the same identifier.
errors.resolution: Ensure all Id attributes are unique across the project.

errors.message: The Component/@Guid attribute's value is not a valid GUID.
errors.resolution: Use a valid GUID format (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx) or use '*' for auto-generation.
See the specific ICE error message for resolution steps.

errors.description: A source file referenced in the project was not found.
errors.resolution: Verify the file path is correct and the file exists.

iceErrors.description: Basic validation of the MSI database schema.
iceErrors.resolution: Ensure database tables conform to the schema.

iceErrors.description: Validates that no duplicate component GUIDs exist.
iceErrors.resolution: Ensure each component has a unique GUID.

iceErrors.description: Validates that file key paths are unique.
iceErrors.resolution: Ensure key path files are not shared between components.

iceErrors.description: Validates that components have proper key paths.
iceErrors.resolution: Ensure each component has exactly one key path.

iceErrors.description: Validates that non-advertised shortcuts have proper targets.
iceErrors.resolution: Use advertised shortcuts or ensure targets exist.

iceErrors.description: Validates per-user and per-machine component mixing.
iceErrors.resolution: Don't mix per-user and per-machine components in the same package.
